title: An Objective Review (Promise)
author: MadTraffic
review:
I have played tons of Battle Royale games: Minecraft Hunger Games, H1Z1, Rules of Survival, PUBG PC, Fortnite PC, Fortnite Mobile. But I can honestly say after playing these Battle Royale games that PUBG Mobile is most likely the most enjoyable and here’s why:
1) Brilliant graphics. I play on an iPhone 6, and Low is an excellent setting. Sure, your frames can drop, but there is no game that doesn’t have some kind of freeze issue.

2) Tons of weapons. There are so many weapons to choose from, and each are viable to play with. (The QBZ on the Sanhok map could maybe use a damage boost, but it’s early yet). Tons of attachments to serve your playing style.

3) Gameplay. The gameplay is never the same. Each combat situation is totally new. You can rage for a bit after a loss, but it’s easy enough to just hop into another match because the matches are just right. Most Matches I play last about 30 minutes if I win.

However, there are some things that we must be aware of:
Ping: my Ping can skyrocket to 1038 on a good day. Players can choose any server they want, but it slows the game to a crawl

Battery: playing a full match can drain an iPhone 6 40% on Low settings.

Loot: Clothes and skins cost A LOT of in-game money. And you get a lot of duplicates, and it can get rather annoying blowing 40k credits and getting 6 red shirts. Clothes are rather easy to obtain though.

Indicators: the indicators that show enemy movement and gunfire can be sporadic. Sometimes footsteps won’t show up even if they are wearing shoes. Directional hearing can be spotty sometimes. But I’m sure these dents will be hammered out over time.

CONGRATS: You read my first review EVER. This should indicate that I hold this game in high esteem. So let’s be clear, I’m not throwing shade at other Battle Royale games, I’m saying that PUBG Mobile is more enjoyable because you don’t need to spend a ton of money on a good phone to play it and have fun.

Regards,
BLACKBOXX

Y’all have a screwed up rating point system regarding losing . And with the new sanhok map. It could take you less than 30 seconds in a match to lose 30+ points and 3-4 hours gaining them back. And that’s with straight wins . Being that they only give 9 rating points or around that for a win . And 2-5 rating points if you’re in top ten . Sometimes less. 
Very displeased with this . It really makes the game not fun . Watching your hard earned ratings points go down the drain over a 30 second run.
